notes: Fastest growing. Paperless submittals. Parameter-based search without login for general data.
strategy: Iterate permit numbers/dates. Target 'New Residential' vs 'Commercial Finish-out'.

notes: Massive volume. CFW Permit Assist Tool integrated. Records separated by module (Building, Planning, etc.).
strategy: Traverse specific modules. Use 'Advanced Search' with date ranges. Session cookies required for deep detail.

notes: High volume of 'Moratorium Exemptions' and 'New Residential'.
strategy: Focus on 'Global Search' API endpoints returning JSON. Track project statuses.

notes: Kaufman County leader. Straightforward HTML structure. 'Collaborator' interface.
strategy: Public search via GET requests with date parameters. Reliable contractor fields.

notes: Migrated Dec 2022. High valuation per permit.
strategy: Target 'Reviews' tab for timestamps. Guest access for contractor search.

notes: Distinguishes between CSS and eReview. High Single-Family volume.
strategy: Target CSS for metadata. Distinguish 'Permit' vs 'Plan' records.

notes: Growth engine for southern sector. Uses MyGov for trade permits, Avolve for plans.
strategy: Target MyGov for metadata (dates, fees, valuations).

notes: Legacy system, prone to timeouts/CAPTCHAs. Deep historical archive.
strategy: Handle ASP.NET VIEWSTATE and session cookies. Scrape off-peak.

notes: All permits/contractor registrations via MyGov. Includes ROW permits.
strategy: Standard MyGov scraping.

notes: Mobile-responsive, API-centric. Real-time inspection results.
strategy: Leverage MGO Connect API.

notes: CRITICAL WARNING: Migrating May 5, 2025. Blackout period April 25-May 4.
strategy: Full historical scrape before April 25. Re-engineer post-migration.

notes: Mature market. Public search of registered contractors.
strategy: eTRAKiT scraper. Identify active commercial GCs.

notes: Transitioning plan management. Aggressive IP blocking.
strategy: Monitor for IP blocking. Watch for Avolve transition.

notes: Allows fee estimation. Industrial focus.
strategy: EnerGov scraper. Reverse-engineer valuations from fees if redacted.

notes: Recently migrated to MGO. Download access to permit certificates.
strategy: MGO Connect scraper. Download certificates for structured data.

notes: Branded EnerGov. Contractor registration required for full details.
strategy: Maintain 'dummy' contractor account.

notes: Granicus product. Highly scrapable. Parcel Search feature.
strategy: SmartGov scraper. Link to GIS data.

notes: Less common vendor. Anonymous complaint/permit tracking.
strategy: Custom parser for CityView.

notes: Map-centric. Public Access.
strategy: Intercept GeoJSON traffic.

notes: Standard EnerGov. 'Public Access' mode available.
strategy: Use Public Access mode to avoid login.

notes: Requires contractor re-registration. Database purge likely.
strategy: Treat pre-migration data as fragmented.

notes: Centralized platform. Handles ROW permits.
strategy: EnerGov scraper. High value single source.

notes: Stable since 2018. Deep historical dataset.
strategy: Good for training ML models.

notes: Directs to web.mygov.us. Requires 'Collaborator' sign up for some features.
strategy: Code reuse with Fate/Forney.

notes: Contractor login portal. Publishes static monthly reports.
strategy: Fallback to PDF reports if eTRAKiT fails.

notes: Allows photo documentation for inspections.
strategy: Potential for computer vision on image data.

notes: MyGov for trade permits. Plans may be physical.
strategy: Hybrid approach.

notes: Light-weight. Trade permit focus. Monthly Reports.
strategy: Scrape Monthly Reports for new construction.

notes: Unique domain wrapper. Accela-based logic. 'Save for Later' feature.
strategy: Custom navigation logic. Session persistence.

notes: Uncommon vendor. URL structure is parameter-based (installationID=435).
strategy: Easy to scrape once ID identified.

notes: Clean UI.
High commercial value.
Commercial logistics focus.
Modern, API-driven.
Transitioning. Account required.
Publishes monthly reports as audit trail.
High volume infill. Online application.
'Collaborator' access required.
Western edge anchor.
Mandatory online usage since 2021.
Transitioning Oct 2024.
Payments and tracking.

Luxury market.
